rationales.stimulation: He is energized by improvisational, high-variance teaching and drawn to an adventurous wilderness role.
rationales.self_direction: He pushes independent curriculum design rather than passively accepting standardized scripts.
rationales.conformity: He openly resists district pacing and rubric expectations, describing strong friction with institutional norms.

rationales.stimulation: He describes feeling dulled by a predictable routine he chose over uncertainty.
rationales.security: His reflection explicitly frames the tradeoff as moving from unknown conditions to a stable, repeatable structure.

rationales.stimulation: He creates a dynamic, high-engagement debate format and experiences it as the most alive version of the job.
rationales.self_direction: He abandons the planned lesson in real time based on his own pedagogical judgment.
rationales.conformity: He knowingly breaks the expected binder-and-observation pattern to pursue a different classroom approach.

rationales.stimulation: He remains attracted to the six-month wilderness contract and open-ended life direction.
rationales.security: He experiences long-term planning and settled milestones as constricting rather than reassuring.

rationales.stimulation: He is pulled toward the project-based innovation class because it offers novelty and student-driven challenge.
rationales.self_direction: His decision frame centers whether the career container allows him to teach in a way that fits his own principles.
